EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
• Burner inserter located at (-3.5, 27.5) with drop position (-3.5, 28.5)

Use-case:
• Extracts items from the source and provides a drop point for downstream transport.

─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Approximately Position (2.5–3.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
• Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
• Dedicated burner inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT
• An associated new factory burner inserter retrieved at (2.5, 16.5)
• Adjacent assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5)

Use-case:
• Forms the interface for copper cable production by receiving items via inserters and feeding them into the assembling process.

─────────────────────
### Belt Depot at Position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) serving as the depot
• Dedicated transport belt segment placed at (4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the depot chest
• Dedicated depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP

Use-case:
• Acts as an isolated belt depot to receive items from the extraction system and serve as the connection node for further transport.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors
  – When connecting transport belts, ensure the final target is an inserter (which inputs items into the target machine) rather than a steam engine. Validate the target’s entity type before attempting the connection.

• Entity Placement Distance Errors
  – If placement fails because the target is too far from the player (as indicated by “target position is too far”), move closer to the desired location before placing the entity.

• Undefined Variable Errors
  – Avoid reference errors (e.g. “target_chest is not defined”) by verifying that all variable names used for entity placement or connection are correctly defined and consistently referenced.

• Inventory Shortage Errors
  – Confirm that the necessary item (for example, a wooden chest) is present in the player’s inventory prior to attempting placement to prevent “no [item] in inventory” errors.
